text: this island is marked with
bullet-riddled abandoned buildings and
decaying military tanks relics of the
Gulf War it sits 20 kilometres from
Kuwait City in the northern part of the
Persian Gulf
once one of Kuwait's only inhabited
islands salaka was defaced during the
Iraqi invasion of Kuwait this was once a
bank and this a hotel in August of 1990
Iraqi forces seized the island sending
its estimated 2,000 residents to the
mainland US forces used loudspeakers on
helicopters to call on Iraqi troops to
surrender the islands has returned to
Kuwait without a ground assault after
the war few residents returned and the
Kuwaiti army started using the island
for military exercises today there is a
small tourism industry which includes a
museum and some co-eds maintain
temporary residences
this land close to where the Tigris and
Euphrates rivers spill out into the Gulf
was also once the hub of the ancient
Dillman civilization in 2013 Kuwait
submitted a bid to UNESCO to mark the
area as a world heritage site the
government had also announced plans to
expand the island into a luxurious
tourist hub but that hasn't come to
fruition
